article.headline: Prairie View 76, Norfolk St. 71
article.story: PRAIRIE VIEW, Texas (AP) -- Freddie Edo came off the bench to lead Prairie View with 19 points and the Panthers stymied Norfolk State's second-half rally to pull out a 76-71 win on Monday night. Jonathan Dixon added 13 points for Prairie View (2-3) as the Panthers sent Norfolk State (1-4) to its fourth straight loss. Prairie View took a 41-22 lead into halftime and led by 19 points with seven minutes remaining. That's when Michael Deloach spurred Norfolk State's late charge and the Spartans drew the score to 74-71 with 37 seconds remaining. Brian Ezeh hit two free throws with 14 seconds left to seal Prairie View's win. Deloach scored 16 of his team-high 20 points in the game's last 7:30 minutes and hit a career-high three 3-pointers. Ezeh added six rebounds for Prairie View. Prairie View shot 48 percent from the field for the game to Norfolk State's 47 percent.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
